channel.title: Haiku on Silence Speaks
channel.description: Recent content in Haiku on Silence Speaks

item.title: Haiku #14
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)
item.description: He walks a long ways. He would have ran, but running Is conspicuous.

item.title: Haiku #13
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)
item.description: When you tell a lie, You tell the truth about you And your character.

item.title: Haiku #12
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)
item.description: It still trickles down Long after the winds swept through. Tears outlive terror.

item.title: Haiku #7
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)
item.description: You may interchange My middle name with either Silence or solace

item.title: Haiku #8
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)
item.description: It is all folly! The grass withers, flowers fade, But the weeds still grow.

item.title: Haiku #4
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)

item.title: Haiku #3
item.author: me@silentsilas.com (Silent Silas)
item.description: We’re in a hurry. Now by watching us humans, The cold wind is too.
